solution_line_template: On Tuesday, Oliver worked out for {monday_hours} - {tuesday_less} = <<{monday_hours}-{tuesday_less}={tuesday_hours}>>{tuesday_hours} hours.
On Wednesday he decided to work out twice as much as on Monday, so for {wednesday_multiplier} * {monday_hours} = <<{wednesday_multiplier}*{monday_hours}={wednesday_hours}>>{wednesday_hours} hours.
On Thursday, at home, Oliver trained twice as much as on Tuesday, so for {thursday_multiplier} * {tuesday_hours} = <<{thursday_multiplier}*{tuesday_hours}={thursday_hours}>>{thursday_hours} hours.

In total Oliver trained for {monday_hours} + {tuesday_hours} + {wednesday_hours} + {thursday_hours} = <<{monday_hours}+{tuesday_hours}+{wednesday_hours}+{thursday_hours}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
